definition[0]: a situation that seems strange because it involves two ideas or qualities that are very different
example[0]: Itâ€™s a paradox that in such a rich country there can be so much poverty.
definition[1]: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true
example[1]: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
definition[2]: the use of statements that are a paradox in writing or speech
